trans-unit.source: How to encode an asset using Media Encoder Standard
trans-unit.target: How to encode an asset using Media Encoder Standard

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use .NET to encode an asset using Media Encoder Strandard.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use .NET to encode an asset using Media Encoder Strandard.

trans-unit.source: How to encode an asset using Media Encoder Standard
trans-unit.target: How to encode an asset using Media Encoder Standard

trans-unit.source: Encoding jobs are one of the most common processing operations in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Encoding jobs are one of the most common processing operations in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: You create encoding jobs to convert media files from one encoding to another.
trans-unit.target: You create encoding jobs to convert media files from one encoding to another.

trans-unit.source: When you encode, you can use the Media Services built-in Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: When you encode, you can use the Media Services built-in Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: You can also use an encoder provided by a Media Services partner; third party encoders are available through the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: You can also use an encoder provided by a Media Services partner; third party encoders are available through the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use .NET to encode your assets with Media Encoder Standard. Media Encoder Standard is configured using one of the encoder presets described <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use .NET to encode your assets with Media Encoder Standard. Media Encoder Standard is configured using one of the encoder presets described <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The current release of the media processor requires you to pass in an entire XML or JSON string as the encoding preset.
trans-unit.target: The current release of the media processor requires you to pass in an entire XML or JSON string as the encoding preset.

trans-unit.source: Support for passing in a named string, like "H264 Multiple Bitrate 720p", will be available via a service update shortly.
trans-unit.target: Support for passing in a named string, like "H264 Multiple Bitrate 720p", will be available via a service update shortly.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to always encode your mezzanine files into an adaptive bitrate MP4 set and then convert the set to the desired format using the <link><linkText>Dynamic Packaging</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to always encode your mezzanine files into an adaptive bitrate MP4 set and then convert the set to the desired format using the <link><linkText>Dynamic Packaging</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you must first get at least one On-demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you must first get at least one On-demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Scale Media Services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Scale Media Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If your output asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.
trans-unit.target: If your output asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link><linkText>Configuring asset delivery policy</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link><linkText>Configuring asset delivery policy</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses Media Services .NET SDK to perform the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: The following code example uses Media Services .NET SDK to perform the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Create an encoding job.
trans-unit.target: Create an encoding job.

trans-unit.source: Get a reference to the Media Encoder Standard encoder.
trans-unit.target: Get a reference to the Media Encoder Standard encoder.

trans-unit.source: Load the preset XML from one of the presets shown <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Load the preset XML from one of the presets shown <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Add a single encoding task to the job.
trans-unit.target: Add a single encoding task to the job.

trans-unit.source: Specify the input asset to be encoded.
trans-unit.target: Specify the input asset to be encoded.

trans-unit.source: Create an output asset that will contain the encoded asset.
trans-unit.target: Create an output asset that will contain the encoded asset.

trans-unit.source: Add an event handler to check the job progress.
trans-unit.target: Add an event handler to check the job progress.

trans-unit.source: Submit the job.
trans-unit.target: Submit the job.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Media Services Encoding Overview</linkText><title></title></link>
